About Me

Welcome to My Literary World

Hello, and welcome to RoughNotes. I'm someone who loves to read and write poems, though I'm not a professional writer by any means. This is simply my corner of the internet where words find their home and stories come to life.

I sometimes share my personal experiences as well, weaving them into stories and poems that reflect the beauty and complexity of everyday life. Writing has become my way of making sense of the world around me, one word at a time.

Why I Created This Space

I created this page because at times I just want to share things, but I don't know with whom to share them. There's something magical about putting your thoughts into words and releasing them into the world, hoping they might resonate with someone, somewhere.

Maybe you've felt that way too—having thoughts, feelings, or stories that feel too precious to keep locked away, yet too personal to share with just anyone. This space is for those moments, those quiet revelations that deserve to be heard.

My Writing Journey

My love for words began with reading. Books were my escape, my teachers, my friends during quiet afternoons. Slowly, I discovered that creating those worlds myself brought even greater joy than discovering them in others' work.

I find inspiration everywhere—in conversations overheard on buses, in the way morning light filters through my window, in the small moments that make up our days. Life is full of stories waiting to be told, and I'm grateful to have found a way to share some of them with you.

What You'll Find Here

This space is home to my stories and poems, ranging from gentle fiction to personal reflections, often exploring themes of connection, discovery, and the magic hidden in everyday life. Some pieces come from my imagination, others from my own experiences walking through this beautiful, complicated world.

I hope my words resonate with you, inspire you, or simply provide a moment of connection in your day. Thank you for taking the time to visit and read. Your presence here means more than you know.

Stay Connected

Subscribe to receive new stories and poems directly in your inbox. Join our community of readers who appreciate the beauty of words.
